description: The building is a church worship area with an additional hall, meeting rooms, offices, a children's library and 33 affordable units of accommodation made up of one, two and three bedroom flats.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Westbourne Park Paptist Church was first opened in 1877 having moved from Praed Street Paddington.  It was the centre for the Ministry of Rev Dr John Clifford, a significant non-conformist in Victorian London.
On February 19th 1944 fire bombs burned the first building down. This was replaced in 1962 with a modern building.

However, by the beginning of the 21st Century, this building was no longer adequate, there was no access for those with limited mobility, the heating, ventilation, electrics and acoustics were all causing significant issues. In addition, the focus of church life had significantly broadened; instead of being a building simply to host worship services and occasional other activities, the life of the church involved the building being used every single day by a wide range of activities.

factsheet.heading: Challenges
paragraphs: The desire to bring significant change was challenging, we had a huge asset in terms of land value but very little revenue to effect change. After much time and a number of false starts, the church partnered with Dolphin Living to provide much needed affordable housing in Westminster, in return for a new suite of facilities fit for the new century.
